Requirement Description: Serve as after-school core program providers for K–8th grade students under the After School Education and Safety (ASES) Program and for TK-6th grade students under the Expanded Learning Opportunities Program (ELO-P).
Compliance/Response Method: Address in Proposal Narrative (Need for Program & Program Design sections)

Requirement Description: Deliver services for 180 school days after regular school hours until 6:00 PM.
Compliance/Response Method: Address in Proposal Narrative (Program Design section)

Requirement Description: Deliver structured, engaging, and developmentally appropriate programming that supports students' academic success, social-emotional learning, and enrichment—aligned with NUSD goals through the LEAP Academy, with an intentional focus on literacy and math.
Compliance/Response Method: Address in Proposal Narrative (Need for Program, Program Design, High-Quality Programming sections), Application Questions (Q10)

Requirement Description: ELO-P programming requires providers to offer approximately 3–4 hours of after-school instruction each day, focusing on English learners, socioeconomically disadvantaged students, or foster youth. Summer and intersession programs will be addressed in a separate RFP.
Compliance/Response Method: Address in Proposal Narrative (Program Design section), Application Questions

Requirement Description: Offer academic support, including tutoring, homework help, literacy, and math enrichment.
Compliance/Response Method: Address in Proposal Narrative (Program Design, High-Quality Programming sections), Assurances (Appendix E)

Requirement Description: Offer enrichment activities, including STEAM, physical education, visual and performing arts, leadership, and social-emotional learning.
Compliance/Response Method: Address in Proposal Narrative (Program Design, High-Quality Programming sections), Assurances (Appendix E)

Requirement Description: Offer youth development activities fostering teamwork, problem-solving, and personal growth.
Compliance/Response Method: Address in Proposal Narrative (Program Design section), Assurances (Appendix E)

Requirement Description: Offer family engagement opportunities to encourage family participation and strengthen school-community connections.
Compliance/Response Method: Address in Proposal Narrative (Program Design section)

Requirement Description: Ensure qualified, trained personnel ensuring a safe, inclusive, and engaging environment.
Compliance/Response Method: Address in Proposal Narrative (Organizational Focus, Professional Development sections), Application Questions (Q15, Q20)

Requirement Description: Demonstrate experience operating high-quality after-school or expanded learning programs for TK-8th grade students.
Compliance/Response Method: Address in Proposal Narrative (Need for Program section), Application Questions (Q7)

Requirement Description: Ability to provide services for 180 school days, from school dismissal until 6:00 PM.
Compliance/Response Method: Address in Proposal Narrative (Program Design section)

Requirement Description: Compliance with all applicable district, state, and federal regulations, including Education Code requirements for ASES and ELO-P.
Compliance/Response Method: Provide Assurances to Meet Requirements (Appendix E), Non-Collusion Affidavit (Appendix F), Non-Disclosure Agreement (Appendix G)

Requirement Description: Staff qualifications, including background checks, aligned with program and safety standards. Fingerprint clearance through CA DOJ and FBI.
Evaluation Criteria/Points (if applicabl: Submit Fingerprinting/Background check certification (Appendix H), Address in Proposal Narrative (Organizational Focus, High-Quality Programming sections)

Requirement Description: Capacity to coordinate with school administration and community partners to deliver a cohesive program.
Compliance/Response Method: Address in Proposal Narrative (Program Design, Professional Development sections), Application Questions (Q8, Q17)

Requirement Description: Have the capacity to serve up to forty (40) students in grades of Transitional Kindergarten (TK) and Kindergarten per site to comply with the 1:10 ratio.
Compliance/Response Method: Address in School Site Selection Sheet (Appendix D), Assurances (Appendix E), Application Questions (Q20)

Requirement Description: Maintain a student to staff member ratio of no more than 20:1 for grades 1-8, and 1:10 for TK and Kindergarten during the contract duration.
Evaluation Criteria/Points (if applicabl: Provide Assurances (Appendix E), Address in Application Questions (Q20)

Requirement Description: Total budget may not exceed $2,500 per student.
Evaluation Criteria/Points (if applicabl: Submit Itemized Budget per school site (Attachment)

Requirement Description: Submit a detailed, itemized budget for each school proposed, clearly identifying costs by category (staffing, materials/supplies, professional development, transportation, administrative/overhead).
Evaluation Criteria/Points (if applicabl: Submit Itemized Budget per school site (Attachment)

Requirement Description: Each itemized budget must be submitted as a separate attachment for each school site (e.g., "Itemized Budget – Jefferson"). Failure may result in disqualification.
column7: Submit Itemized Budget per school site (Attachment)

Requirement Description: For schools offering both ASES and LEAP programs, vendors must provide separate billing and reporting for each program.
Compliance/Response Method: Acknowledge in Proposal Narrative, describe approach in Application Questions

Requirement Description: Providers will have an accounting system to create financial reports and income statements, balance sheets specific to NUSD, and provide them quarterly. Provide most recent external audit report with proposal and annually thereafter. Allow District to audit.
Evaluation Criteria/Points (if applicabl: Submit Financial Statements/Audit, Address in Proposal Narrative (Success & Sustainability section)

Requirement Description: Align programming with NUSD's Vision, Strategic Plan, and all applicable State and Federal laws.
Compliance/Response Method: Address in Proposal Narrative (Program Design section), Application Questions (Q16)

Requirement Description: Provide academic support, enrichment, and community-building activities tailored to each school's needs.
Compliance/Response Method: Address in Proposal Narrative (Program Design section), Application Questions (Q10)

Requirement Description: Potentially serve multiple NUSD sites, including TK-5, TK–6, TK–8, and/or 7–8 schools, based on district and site needs.
Compliance/Response Method: Indicate proposed sites and maximum capacity in School Site Selection Sheet (Appendix D), Application Questions (Q5)

Requirement Description: Deliver programming that may include Spanish dual-immersion for Heredia-Arriaga School while meeting all ELO-P requirements.
Compliance/Response Method: Indicate capacity and approach in Proposal Narrative (Program Design section)

Requirement Description: Coordinate with NUSD contracted third-party enrichment providers for scheduling and delivery of activities.
Compliance/Response Method: Address in Proposal Narrative (Program Design section), Application Questions (Q17)

Requirement Description: Proposals must be received by September 26, 2025, at 4pm (Pacific). Late submissions will be rejected.
All proposals must be submitted electronically through SecureBids. No proposals or documents submitted outside of the Secure Bids platform will be considered.
column7: Submit via Secure Bids platform, create account in advance

Requirement Description: All proposals must be submitted in PDF format, comprehensively addressing all requirements, and following the specified order of sections, including all appendices and attachments. Failure to follow format or include all documents may result in reduced points or disqualification.
Compliance/Response Method: Adhere to prescribed format and order

Requirement Description: Submit all documents listed in the Proposal Checklist (Appendix B): Cover Page (A), Checklist (B), References (C), School Site Selection Sheet (D), Itemized Budget (Attachment), Proposal Narrative (Attachment - addressing Need for Program, Program Design, Organizational Focus, Project Evaluation, Success & Sustainability, Other Points), Application Questions (Attachment), Assurances (E), Non-Collusion (F), Non-Disclosure (G), Fingerprinting Cert (H), Workers Comp Cert (I).

Questions regarding the RFP must be submitted via email to bidsubmission@natomasunified.org with subject line “Questions: NUSD RFP 2025 for After School Core Program Providers" by September 12, 2025, at 4pm.
Compliance/Response Method: Submit questions by deadline

Requirement Description: Awarded provider(s) shall act as an independent contractor.
Compliance/Response Method: Acknowledge agreement to terms

Requirement Description: Maintain Commercial General Liability, Sexual Abuse-Molestation (if applicable), Business Automobile Liability (if applicable), Professional Liability (if applicable), Workers' Compensation, and Cyber Liability (if applicable) with specified minimum limits. Furnish certificates, additional insured endorsements, and waivers prior to service commencement.
Compliance/Response Method: Provide evidence of insurance

Requirement Description: Indemnify, defend, and hold harmless NUSD from liabilities arising out of performance.
Compliance/Response Method: Acknowledge agreement to terms

Requirement Description: If providing technology services involving student records, sign a separate California Student Data Privacy Agreement and attach certification.
Compliance/Response Method: Submit signed California Student Data Privacy Agreement & certification (if applicable)

Requirement Description: Submit a completed IRS Form W-9.
Compliance/Response Method: Submit IRS Form W-9

Requirement Description: Agreement is contingent upon formal approval by the District's Board of Trustees.
Compliance/Response Method: Acknowledge agreement to terms

Requirement Description: Applicants selected as a Core After School Program Provider are prohibited from simultaneously contracting as an Enrichment Service Provider under the RFQ process.
Compliance/Response Method: Acknowledge understanding and commitment to choose one role

Requirement Description: Comply with the Natomas Unified School District's tobacco-free policy.
Compliance/Response Method: Acknowledge agreement to terms

Requirement Description: Understand and adhere to the formal written protest procedures, including submission to the Director of Purchasing & Warehouse within five (5) business days following notification of awardee selection.
Compliance/Response Method: Acknowledge understanding of protest procedures
